summary: An ENB setup for light-hearted, vintage look.
descriptionHtml:
The setup is probably always work-in-progress, so feel free to make suggestions.

[color=#FFBF00][b]NEWS[/b][/color]

Version 2.0 is online. It marks a major rewrite, and almost every aspect of the setup has been tweaked. The cartoony vintage look is still intact, but there\'s quite a bit more contrast, and the nights and dungeons are much better balanced now.

[color=#FFBF00][b]ADDITIONALLY RECOMMENDED[/b][/color]

[b][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=9930]Revamped Exterior Fog by gargorias[/url][/b]
Removes some of the exterior haze. Used in all screenshots.

[color=#FFBF00][b]INSTALLATION[/b][/color]

1. First make sure you make a backup of your previous ENB setup and any other post-processing wrapper or injector using d3d9.dll file, if any.

2. Download the original ENBSeries v0.102 Tatsudoshi for TES Skyrim from [url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0102.htm]here[/url] and copy d3d9.dll from the installation package to your Skyrim folder.

3. Copy the contents of either Core folder to your Skyrim program folder and Data folder. If you want to use the depth of field effect, select folder labeled DOF. If you don\'t want to use the depth of field effect, use NO DOF folder. If you don\'t know where your Skyrim folder is located, click right mouse button on the Skyrim shortcut and select Open file location. A Windows Explorer window will now open in the correct folder. Additionally, if you want to use white cinematic bars, copy the enbeffect.fx file located in Vignette folder to your Skyrim program folder. Note that you can switch the enbeffect.fx file while the game is running.

4. [b][color=#FF0000]IMPORTANT![/color][/b] Open SkyrimPrefs.ini located in your My Games/Skyrim folder with Notepad and, if not present, add the following line under [Display]:

	bFloatPointRenderTarget=1

5. Run the Skyrim launcher and make sure that the data file load order is exactly as follows:

	Realistic Lighting.esp
	Realistic Lighting Patcher.esp
	RevampedExteriorFog.esp
	Dark Dungeons for ENB.esp

See a [url=http://img21.imageshack.us/img21/4164/loadorder.jpg]screenshot[/url].

6. Launch the game! Remember to adjust in-game brightness to your liking. I have it set around the middle.

[color=#FFBF00][b]UNINSTALLATION[/b][/color]

Delete the following files from your Skyrim program folder:

	d3d9.dll
	enbbloom.fx
	enbeffect.fx
	enbeffectprepass.fx
	enbpalette.bmp
	enbseries.ini

And the following files from Skyrim/Data folder:

	Dark Dungeons for ENB.esp
	Realistic Lighting.esp
	Realistic Lighting Patcher.esp
	RevampedExteriorFog.esp

[color=#FFBF00][b]CREDITS AND ADDITIONAL THANKS[/b][/color]

Original ENBSeries by Boris Vorontsov (http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=2971)
Original Cinematic Lighting ENB by HD6 (http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=4142)
Depth of field, sharpening and chromatic aberration code by Matso (http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=5587)
Realistic Lighting With Customization by Pluto, 747823, Leviathan1753, Sydney666 (http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7654)

Special thanks to trillville (http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=11930), whose brilliant palette proved to be enlightening.
Also thanks to Jasmin (http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=12549) for the idea and basic implementation of cinematic bars.
author: mindflux
